entrance.title: Reading Room
entrance.description: You are standing in a reading room. There are desks and chairs on soft carpeted floor, tall shelves line the walls. There is a door behind a counter to the North.

items.name: Leaflet
items.description: The leaflet reads: “Tate Archive collects and makes accessible a wealth of material primarily relating to the history of British art from 1900 to the present.”

items.name: Desk
items.description: They are hardwood desks of massive construction with a leather writing surface laid into the top.

items.name: Chair
items.description: The chairs are made of polished steel and soft black leather. Very heavy.

items.name: Counter
items.description: The counter is chest-high, with dark-grey linoleum sides and an oak top. Leaflets are stacked in one corner.

items.name: Shelves
items.description: The shelves reach from floor to ceiling. They are filled with green binders.

visibleItems.description: Its a green binder. The contents are useless.
visibleItems.name: Green Binder

items.name: Floor
items.description: The light-grey carpet is so dense you can barely hear your own footsteps.

corridor1.title: Corridor
corridor1.description: You are in a brightly-lit corridor. The walls on either side are made of steel wire mesh painted white, beyond which rows of storage shelves are visible. You see a small desk and chair to one side. There is a door to the North, leading to a small office, and the East. The reading room lies behind you, to the South.

items.name: Lights
items.description: The flourescent tubes exude cold light and a low electric hum.
Utilitarian. Scattered across the wooden surface you see $visibleItems.
items.searchDescription: You search the desk. After a little while, you find an access card under a stack of acquisition forms.

visibleItems.name: Paper Files
visibleItems.description: You don't see anything special about the paper files.

visibleItems.name: Clipboard
visibleItems.description: The clipboard is made of thin plywood. Several sheets of paper bearing unintelligible notes are attached to it.

hiddenItems.name: Access Card (Level 2)
hiddenItems.description: An access card similar to yours.

items.description: There is nothing special about the chair.
The walls are made of steel wire mesh, painted white. They look solid.
It's made of the same steel wire mesh as the walls, attached with massive security hinges. Underneath a sign reading "These doors must be kept locked at all times", a card-reader is attached.

keys.message: The door has no visible lock — must be electronic.

accesscard.message: A second after you hold the card up to the reader, a small light flashes green and the electronic lock on the door springs open.

onShelf.title: On top of the shelf
onShelf.description: You've climbed to the top of the shelf. Surprisingly, there is barely any dust up here. Between the fluorecent tubes just above your head, you make out a hatch in the ceiling.

customTriggers.message: The hatch swings open, revealing a ventilation shaft.

vent1.title: In the vents
vent1.description: The ventilation tunnel is barely big enough to crawl through. It's pitch black. The quiet hum of the climate control system has grown to a roar. The vent extends to the South, behind you is the latch leading back down to the Red Store.

vent2.title: Further down the vent
vent2.description: There is a latch leading down to the room below.

store1.title: Red Store
store1.description: You're in a vast storage room lit by neon tubes. You hear a humming noise from the climate control system. There is a row of light-grey shelves mounted on steel tracks embedded into the floor. The shelves are numbered 1 to 14 in large lettering. A door to the West leads back to the corridor, further store rooms lie to the South.

items.description: The shelves look heavy. To see what they contain, you'll have to walk closer to one.
Steel, polished to a high sheen by repeated use.

store2.title: Blue Store
store2.description: You have entered another store room. It looks nearly identical to the first one — linoleum floor. Except the shelves here are blue. The Red Store is behind a door to the North, further store rooms lie to the South.

store3.title: White Store
store3.description: Another store. It looks identical to the two others, except the shelves here are white. The Blue and Red stores are to the North, there is a door to the South.

quarantine.title: Quarantine
quarantine.description: This is where boxes of archive material are checked for bugs and mould before we move them into permanent storage.

loadingDock.title: Loading Dock
loadingDock.description: The loading dock has space for two trucks, though it is currently empty. A raised concrete platform allows level access to whatever goods are being delivered. A handful of steps lead down to streetlevel.

initialInventory.name: Keys
initialInventory.description: They're your housekeys, probably of little use in the archive.

init: You awake in the reading room. /n /n Start by typing “look around”, or type “help” to show a list of available commands.
help: You control your character by typing text commands into the box at the bottom of the screen, and hitting Enter on the keyboard. Most valid commands come in the form of “[verb]” or “[verb] [noun].” /n /n Nouns /n Most things in the game world can be referenced by their name. Type “look at [noun]” to get details about any given item you encounter. When you enter a new location, some objects may be hidden. Examine your surroundings to reveal them. /n/n Verbs /n Common verbs include “go”, “take”, “look”, “search”, and “use”, but additional verbs may become available in certain situations. /n/n Movement/n To move your character around the game world, type “go” followed by a compass direction. For instance, “go north” will move your character to the north. Read the descriptions of your surroundings closely to find out where you can go. /n/n Inventory /n You can pick up objects you encounter throughout the game by typing “take [noun]”. These will be added to your inventory. To see what you're carrying, type “inventory”. To use items on your inventory, type a command in the form “use [noun] on [noun]”, for instance: “use key on door”.  /n/n Other useful commands /n Type “reset” to start over, and “help” to display this message.
cantGoThatWay: You can't go in that direction
cantTakeThat: Better to leave that where it is.
didntUnderstand: That's not a word I know.
That's not a word I recognise.
noSuchThing: There is no such thing here.
You can't see any such thing.
itemDidntWork: I don't think that would work.
giveCompass: You'll have to say which direction to go in.
giveTarget: You'll have to say what you want to use the % on.
hint: Remember you can type “help” to view a list of available commands. If you're stuck, maybe look at your surroundings by typing “look around”.
shelfDescription: The archive shelf towers over you. On its long steel racks, hundreds of cardboard boxes of various shapes are neatly arranged.
